title: 111_hr899
content: The Act is titled the "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" and requires a special election in case of a vacancy in the office of a Senator. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" mandates a special election to fill a Senate vacancy. The President of the Senate certifies the vacancy, and the state's chief executive must hold a special election within 90 days. State laws govern the special election process, except for vacancies near a regularly scheduled election. The subsection mandates a special election to fill a Senate vacancy in accordance with applicable State laws. Exceptions apply for vacancies near regularly scheduled elections, with the President of the Senate issuing certification within specific timeframes. Nothing in this section affects the state's authority under the Constitution. The section outlines the timeframe for filling a Senate vacancy, allowing for temporary appointments by the state's chief executive until a special election is held. It clarifies that this does not affect the state's authority under the Constitution. SEC. 3 of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 introduces payments to reimburse states for costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. This section aims to provide financial support to states for conducting special elections. The Commission will make payments to eligible States to cover costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. States must submit a statement detailing the costs for reimbursement. The Commission will reimburse States for 50% of the reasonable costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies, including primary election costs. Payments will be made within 30 days of receiving the State's cost statement. Additional information may be required by the Commission. No payment will be made unless the State agrees to repay any excess amount received compared to the actual costs incurred. Authorization of appropriations for payments under this part for fiscal year 2009 and beyond is granted to the Commission.
